alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Sebastian; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 3:42AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Franklin, Crawford, northern Sebastian and southeastern Washington Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 342 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles west of West Fork to 2 miles west of Chester to 3 miles southeast of Van Buren. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Mountainburg... Alma... Barling... Elkins... West Fork... Lavaca... Mulberry... Greenland... Dyer... Winslow... Chester... Rudy... Blackburn... Fort Smith Regional Airport... Devils Den State Park... Brentwood... Lake Fort Smith... Fern... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 5 and 23. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 4, and between mile markers 7 and 10. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
